page.title: 04Barrington village school
page.content: The village school was first opened in 1838. Built near the church on part of the Glebe land of the vicarage. The school house was thatched . In 1859 the building was extended and what is now the school hall was built and roofed with slates. The belfry was also built then and the school bell hung. The school was known as the Barrington National School. In 1902 with the passing of the 1902 Education Act the school became an elementary school. In 1956 the school was reorganised into infants and juniors and in 1960 an additional classroom was built. In 1969 another two new classrooms were added and this is how it stands today. In 1984 the schoolhouse was rethatched with Norfolk reed and in 1985 the hall was retiled with Welsh slates, the belfry repaired & the bell re-instated.
